page.title: 08Riverside 2
page.content: Riverside is a very large house l29 years old. It used to belong to the Heywood family and stands in l40 acres of land but 65\70 acres are rented out to local farmers. The house is the school where the children work and live and in the grounds are houses for the headmaster and staff. There are sports grounds,swimming pool and gardens.There are l6 acres of woodland, 2 woods containing coniferous and deciduous trees. One is called Badger Wood because they can be seen playing at night with their cubs. A fox and his vixen bring out their cubs to play on the school lawn. A public footpath runs through the wood so we can see the wide variety of birds and small animals which have their home in the wood. The front porch and an archway are very old and are listed buildings and cannot be destroyed.
